questions.question: What does Manual (M) mode mean?
options: The camera chooses shutter and aperture, you choose ISO
You choose shutter, aperture, and ISO
Only ISO is manual, the rest is automatic
The camera uses exposure compensation to set brightness
questions.reviewHint: Review Manual mode overview—you control shutter, aperture, and ISO (not the camera).

questions.question: When is Manual mode most helpful?
options: Rapidly changing stage lights where every shot is different
Very steady lighting and a series of similar shots
Random street scenes where each frame varies
When you want the camera to adjust each shot for you
questions.reviewHint: See When to use Manual—steady light + consistent results across shots.

questions.question: You want shallow background blur for portraits but consistent brightness. What should you set first in Manual?
options: Aperture to the f-number you want for the look
questions.reviewHint: Start with your creative priority—set aperture first, then match exposure.

questions.question: In pure Manual with Auto ISO OFF, what does Exposure Compensation (±) do?
questions.reviewHint: Exposure compensation in Manual only has effect if Auto ISO is ON.

questions.question: Your test shot is too dark by about one stop. You need to keep the same depth of field and your shutter is still safe. What's the easiest fix?
options: Slow the shutter by one stop
questions.reviewHint: Stops & shutter—add one stop of light by slowing the shutter one stop.

questions.question: What mainly freezes motion?
questions.reviewHint: See Freezing motion—fast shutter speed is the key.

questions.question: Which setting gives more background blur?
questions.reviewHint: Aperture & depth of field—lower f-number = more blur.

questions.question: You've set f/2.8 and 1/250s for the look you want, but the photo is still too dark. What keeps the same DOF and motion while brightening?
questions.reviewHint: ISO & exposure—raise ISO to brighten without changing DOF or motion.

questions.question: Your subject is backlit and their face is dark. In Manual, what should you do?
options: Keep the meter centered; it will be fine
Open up / slow shutter / raise ISO until the subject is correctly exposed
questions.reviewHint: Backlit subjects—expose for the subject, not the bright background.

questions.question: Manual with Auto ISO ON and +1 EC: what happens?
options: ISO increases to brighten by ~1 stop
questions.reviewHint: Manual + Auto ISO—EC biases the ISO brighter/darker.

questions.question: You change from f/4 → f/5.6 (one stop less light) but want motion blur to stay similar. What compensates?
questions.reviewHint: Equivalent exposures—to keep shutter (motion) the same, raise ISO one stop.

questions.question: Sunny 16: On a sunny day at ISO 100, a typical starting exposure near f/16 is:
questions.reviewHint: Sunny 16—start around 1/ISO at f/16 (≈1/100s at ISO 100).
